ccre.ctrl

Interface IJoystickWithPOV

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IJoystick
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractJoystickWithPOV

    public interface IJoystickWithPOV
extends IJoystick
    A joystick with axes, buttons, and POV hats.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FloatInputPoll getPOVAngle(int id)
      Get a channel representing the angle of the POV hat, if it is pressed.

      Get a source representing the angle of the POV hat, if it is pressed.

      • Methods inherited from interface ccre.ctrl.IJoystick

        getAxisChannel, getAxisSource, getButtonChannel, getButtonSource, getXAxisSource, getXChannel, getYAxisSource, getYChannel

    • Method Detail

      • isPOVPressed

        BooleanInputPoll isPOVPressed(int id)
        Get a channel representing whether or not the specified POV hat (starting at one) is pressed.
        Parameters:
        id - the POV hat id.
        Returns:
        the channel representing whether or not the POV hat is pressed.

      • getPOVAngle

        FloatInputPoll getPOVAngle(int id)
        Get a channel representing the angle of the POV hat, if it is pressed. The angle is in degrees from 0 to 360, with zero at the top and increasing clockwise, at least on our tested models. If not pressed (as determined by isPOVPressed), the value is undefined. It can be, but is not necessarily, outside the range of 0-360.
        Parameters:
        id - the POV hat id.
        Returns:
        the channel representing the POV's angle.

      • isPOVPressedSource

        BooleanInput isPOVPressedSource(int id)
        Get a source representing whether or not the specified POV hat (starting at one) is pressed.
        Parameters:
        id - the POV hat id.
        Returns:
        the source representing whether or not the POV hat is pressed.

      • getPOVAngleSource

        FloatInput getPOVAngleSource(int id)
        Get a source representing the angle of the POV hat, if it is pressed. The angle is in degrees from 0 to 360, with zero at the top and increasing clockwise, at least on our tested models. If not pressed (as determined by isPOVPressedSource), the value is undefined. It can be, but is not necessarily, outside the range of 0-360.
        Parameters:
        id - the POV hat id.
        Returns:
        the source representing the POV's angle.
